itemDescription: English physician and public health campaigner

wikipedia_page.main: Lady Eileen Crofton,  (28 March 1919 – 8 October 2010) was a British physician and author. She was best known for her anti-smoking campaigns.

response: *  1919   – Eileen Crofton, British physician and author (d. 2010)
*  2010   – Eileen Crofton, British physician and author (b. 1919)
* Eileen Crofton (1919-2010), Scottish physician, anti-smoking campaigner and author

Crofton was the 2005 recipient of The Union Medal from the IUATLD. The Crofton Award, named in honour of the physician and his wife, physician Eileen Crofton, is given by the Royal Environmental Health Institute of Scotland (REHIS) and ASH Scotland, recognising the "contributions young people in Scotland make towards reducing the harm caused by tobacco".

link_mentions.page: List of Somerville College, Oxford, people
response: *Lady Eileen Crofton MBE (1919–2010), physician and author; best known for her anti-smoking campaigns
